title: Drawing
medium: Pen and brownish-black ink, brush and gray wash on cream paper
markings: Verso, stamp in brown ink: Cooper-Hewitt National Design Museum, Smithsonial Institution (Lugt 457d); stamp in black ink: Juan Jorge Peoli (Lugt 2020); stamp in turquoise: unidentifiable
provenance: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description: Interior scene of ancient Roman temple. Three figures in military garb. On right, soldier taking or stealing idol helped by a man in freemen’s clothes; on left, soldier pointing at thief with a second figure, while third soldier lies injured on the floor with helmet off.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing.
Pen and brownish-black ink, brush and gray wash on cream paper. Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 1931-64-289.
